string.text: Merchants
Journalist who eventually became a seasoned loner. He's rather quiet and secretive, seems to be looking for something very specific within the Zone.
Experienced veteran. Has been in the Zone for a while now.
Former stalker, apparently turned into a walking corpse by some unknown influence...
Monolith Guardian. Best to stay away from him. No details available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith sniper. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith fighter. Well equipped. No detailed information available.
Commander of the military assault.
A military stalker. Well-armed and very dangerous. Details unavailable.
No detailed information is available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.
Unknown military
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.

Young stalker from the nearly extinct "Disciples of Master D." clan. A Tolkienist. After reading all sorts of romantic fantasy novels, he travelled to the Zone to experience its 'wonder's first hand. Many loners thought he wouldn't last long, but this lover of novels has managed to remain alive and well, walking around the Zone for years. Rather bulky for a bookworm.
Wolverine of the Blade Clan, an old stalker who has tramped all over the Zone, lost the fingers on his right hand after an encounter with a bald spot anomaly near Kopachi.
Mole
Captain Maximenko
Pied Piper

There's no reliable information available on him, only a rumor... Word is that he went to the center of the Zone and, for some reason, made a wish to command rodents, earning his nickname. Meeting him is no easy task since he disappeared, and nowadays stalkers are starting to forget about him...
Participant of the deadly battles in the Arena. No detailed information available.
Foreman and teacher for a group of rookies from Cordon.
Arnie
Bar guard. The Barkeep's bodyguard, specifically. Nothing else is known about him.
Garik
Guard at the entrance of the Bar... As quiet as his brother.
Zhorik.

Former veteran stalker who supposedly came to the Zone in order to escape his 'dark' past. Switched occupations to become a barkeep after an unfortunate incident with an anomaly, setting up a cozy bar near the Duty base which slowly became the main gathering hub for veterans and rookies alike.
Barkeep Rat
Beast
Member of Duty's faction and a regular at the Bar. Apparently well connected with local suppliers.
Brome
Good-natured and jolly fellow who loves his hunting rifle, doesn't even bother with other weapons. Hangs around the Bar ever since losing his gun, hoping someone will find it, wherever it is.
Hunter
Mysterious yet knowledgeable stalker. Trades with information at the bar.
Snitch

Experienced stalker from Duty. An ideological fighter who sincerely believes in the faction's cause, eventually becoming the first candidate for the position of leader. Known for being almost the only proper stalker among the faction's ranks, voluntarily going on reconnaissance missions deep within the Zone despite the risks of high psi activity... Has managed to keep a sound mind so far, though.
Captain Ivantsov
Sergeant Kitsenko
Bodyguard of the Arena's host. Only bad things are known about his past, hates his brothers.
Lyolik
Bald

A military stalker who has traveled the Zone up and down. He found his home in the paramilitary group Duty, where he quickly earned great authority thanks to his experience. His main task is to supply the group with weapons, ammunition and medical supplies. Considering Duty's numerous connections with the armed forces on the other side of the Perimeter, it's not hard to guess who the group's main sponsor is. The merchant rarely sells his wares to ordinary stalkers. Kind, gentle. Passionate about collecting weapons.
Duty merchant
Head of security for Duty territory.
Chief of Security
An unidentified man who has been exposed to the Brain Scorcher.
Ryaboy

A veteran of the Zone. Leader of Duty faction, whose ultimate goal is the destruction of the Zone. He came in as part of the first expedition from the Military into the Zone, infamous for failing miserably. He's been leading Duty for several years now, adopting a strict -and oftentimes harsh- code of conduct, demanding full compliance and discipline from his subordinates. Became a shut-in inside his office ever since he managed to dodge multiple attemtps for his life. Impossible to meet him without proper connections.
Duty's General
Alkie
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
One of the bandit leaders. Well armed and very dangerous. No details available.
Greyhound
The Doctor
The Doctor
Unknown Mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Possibly well armed. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Clear Sky group. Collects various information about the Zone, and also deciphers PDAs
Dushman
Experienced stalker. No detailed information available.
Vasily Petrovich
No information.
An experienced stalker. Keeps an ear to the ground.
Zheka Duplet
Kalugin P.I.
Enlisted sergeant. No detailed information available.
Private enlisted soldier. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Lieutenant Chuguikin
Lieutenant of extra-long service. No detailed information available.
Captain of the extra-long service. No detailed information available.
A stalker who has not lost his mind.
Fan

Experienced stalker who came to the Zone several years ago with his partner. During a raid, they stumbled upon a Military squad that was conducting one of their signature murderous operations... His partner didn't survive the encounter. Since then, Ferret holds a deep and personal grudge against all Military personnel. Earned a negative reputation due to thievery and other malicious activities.
Fox
Unknown Mercenary. Possibly heavily armed. No detailed information available.

Rookie stalker. Quickly adapted to the Zone despite only being here for about two months. So far, he hasn't gone further than MedPribor, arguing that there's also something to be had on the outskirts of the Zone. Usually takes contracts for finding artifacts and hunting mutants.
Petrukha
A legendary guide who seems to know his way around the entire Zone. His services are expensive, but it's not just about money... He won't travel with stalkers he doesn't like, regardless of the sum.
Guide
Enlisted sergeant. No detailed information.
Stalker who earned the nickname "Quick" for his ability to be inconspicuous and indispensable. Traders trust him for delicate and covert tasks.
Nimble
Major, commands the army post at the bridge. Cooperates with stalkers, taking a fee for passing through the bridge.
Major Kuznetsov
Private conscript soldier. No detailed information available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.
Unknown Mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Rookie. Recently in the Zone. No detailed information available.
Just a stalker.
Tolik
Commander of the patrol of the Cordon zone.
Commander

Proficient trader. Has been honing his the trade since childhood. In kindergarten he sold colored pencils, at school he sold cigarettes, then light narcotics on the streets. Instantly realized there was good money to be made in the Zone shortly after it came to be. Famous for being able to establish good trade relations with pretty much anyone.
Toad
Enjoys a certain degree of authority among the bandits in the Zone. Borov's accomplice.
Vasya Kaban
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Officer of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Prapor
Rookie. Taking his first steps in the Zone.
Yurik
Experienced stalker. Fishing for artifacts on the Garbage.
Sprout
A rookie. New to the Zone. No detailed information available.
Stalker with a dirty face and no less dirty biography.
Witcher
Experienced stalker. No detailed information available.
A fighter of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Commander of a special forces unit of Duty group. Usually well equipped.
Skull
Fighter of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
A well-known informant throughout the Zone.
Ara
Unknown Mercenary. Well armed and very dangerous. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Apparently new to the Zone. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably well armed. No detailed information available.
Monolith Guardian. Best to stay away from him. No details available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
One of the Zone's veterans, knows it like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.
Free stalker. A man who has rallied people around him, ready to die for a common cause.
Kep
Guard for Lukash, leader of the Freedom faction.
Freedom's cook. A drunkard and a debauchee, but an excellent cook.
Cook
A well-known mechanic in the Zone. He can build a tank out of a tractor.
Screw
Leader of the Freedom faction.
Freedom leader
Master of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Guardian of the Freedom faction. Fanatically devoted to the faction. Well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Chief of Security
Guardian of the Freedom faction. Well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Sullen
Kolyan
Tolyan
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Freedom sniper. No detailed information available.
Fighter of the "Freedom" faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Pavlik
Known for being greedy and unyielding, but they say you can get anything from him.
Freedom Merchant
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Crazy Freedom stalker
A Freedom Stalker. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.
Sasha White
Veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Elite Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Leader of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith Leader
Rookie Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith special forces stalker. No detailed information available.
Private soldier. No details available.
Zombie
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Zombie
Crowbar
Log
Master of the Duty faction. Very well equipped. No detailed information available.
Scientist. No detailed information available.
Scientist guards. No details available.
Assistant
Assistant
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Monolith fighter. Well equipped. No detailed information available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.
One of the Zone's veterans, knows it like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. No details available.
Veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.
Master of the Freedom faction. No details available.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Lyokha Jawbone's replacement.
Lyokha Jawbone
Veteran stalker. Possibly well-equipped. Questionable personality. No detailed information available.
Employee of a mobile science lab. No details available.

Lucky Loner who can't stop getting into trouble, somehow making it out of bad situations in one piece. Lost his eye while traversing the Swamps to retrieve an artifact. Got a prosthetic eyeball since then. Takes advantage of his seemingly natural luck, oftentimes taking suicidal missions from Traders.
Phil

Looter and murderer. Had multiple bounties for his head throughout the years. Was once on good terms with Duty, helped them recapture their territory. Now dwells in the wilderness and robs lone stalkers with his gang.
Lucky
Doctor of Biological Sciences. Outside the Zone, he studied pathogenic mutations in animals. He went to the Zone to study mutations in blind dogs.
Prof. Kruglov
One of the "heroes" of the Mercenaries. A veteran shot by all calibers. A rare psycho and sadist.
Tyrant
One of Freedom's field commanders. Commander of a squad of fighters who call themselves dogs. An anarchist who despises all laws except those of force.
Wolfhound
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith's special unit Crystal, responsible for the safety of the Monolith itself.
Unknown stalker
Beast
Vasya the Boar
Psychomaterial image.
Hog
Crazy
Prapor
Chief of Security
Skull
Outpost commander
Yurik
Zheka Duplet
Fan
Fox
Gordon
Haron
Imp
Ara
Captain Ivantsov
Stalker Mole
Prof. Kruglov
Major Kuznetsov
Lucky
Petrenko
Zhorik
Prof. Sakharov
Ryaboy
Gray
Cap
Capez
Cook
Screw
Lukash
Freedom Stalker
Pavlik
Skinflint
Sullen
Tyrant
Tolik

This formerly cheerful and cheerful stalker once had the misfortune to fall into a trap set by the religious group Sin. In captivity, he miraculously survived all the unthinkable horrible abuse, which was subjected to, but his will was finally and irrevocably broken. The brainwashing had a strange effect on his behavior: now he was a cold-blooded and brutal killer, incapable of expressing emotions. His fanatical devotion to the group's cause has made him one of the most dangerous people in the Zone.

An enigmatic figure who heads the underground religious group Sin, which has settled in the territory of former military warehouses. Not much is known about his past, but if we believe the stories of stalkers who miraculously survived after talking to him, this is a highly educated man who knows about the Zone almost more than the ecologists from Lake Yantar. This is a sadistic preacher, who is feared even by his "brothers". There is an opinion that he is a mutant created by the Zone itself. The only thing left in him is his body structure. For the head of the leader of Sin appointed a huge reward, but so far none of the stalkers have not been able to get to him - he is protected by his flock.

A longtime stalker. Before the evacuation, he lived with his family in a classified military town in the Zone. He was hired by a research institute to protect a scientific expedition of ecologists from a mobile research lab. Well oriented in the Zone, which has saved his life more than once. Very often visits the bar
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.

Came to the Zone looking for adventure. Looks like a comic book hero from the '60s. He is called different names: Batman, Macho, Black Cloak, Banderos and, although the fact that he has been in the Zone for two years and is still alive speaks volumes, he is still not taken seriously, which hurts him a lot.

Ferocious, angry, rude, selfish, cruel, unfeeling, cold. No one knows when or how he got into the Zone. He is feared and disliked. In the Zone simply lives, he has no future and no past. After one of his many forays into the Zone, he lost his memory and forgot a lot of things. He can't remember where he comes from, he can't remember his real name, he often has memory lapses. For example, he can forget a new acquaintance an hour after meeting him and, having perceived him as an enemy, kill him.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Unknown stalker. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
Guardian of the Duty faction. Unless you are their friend, you should avoid them. Details unavailable.
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
A fighter of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.

Boor, sycophant, hypocrite, coward. Barin's life credo could be called the phrase "after us there will be a flood". He tries to capitalize on everything. He's very ambitious and resentful. He came to the Zone, as banal as it may sound, for money. And for the second year in the Zone is engaged in the extraction of material values by any means.
A fighter of the Duty faction. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.

He's an official recruiter for the SBU. Often sits in a bar. Everyone knows about it, and also about the fact that if it gets too tight, you should go to him. However, after this step the way back to honest stalkers will be closed.

In everyday life phlegmatic, does not express his emotions, calm. However, with strong impressions, he is irascible, aggressive. Intellectual. Materialist, terribly regrets that he got into the Zone. After graduating from medical school he was sent to the Zone, where the camp of scientists needed an assistant neurosurgeon. He dissects the brains of mutants and studies their psychokinetic abilities. Waiting for a pension and the opportunity to live in the capital city away from this dead place.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably well armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably well armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably well armed. No detailed information available.
Unknown Mercenary. Probably well armed. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
No detailed information is available.
A military stalker. Well-armed and very dangerous. Details unavailable.
Private soldier. No details available.
No detailed information is available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.
Experienced stalker. No detailed information available.

Incredibly lucky stalker. Many times his group was on the brink of death, and always he was the only one who managed to save himself. Stalkers have a bad reputation as an unlucky talisman. Since some time he's been walking alone.
One of the Zone's veterans. This stalker knows the Zone like the back of his hand. Usually well equipped and very dangerous. No detailed information is available.
A smuggler with a long history.

Ex-Afghan. During one of the mujahideen ambushes, he came to believe in God. After Afghanistan he immigrated to Poland, where he entered the seminary. After graduating from the seminary he preaches for some time in the Lviv Catholic Church. After the explosion at Chernobyl NPP he signed up as a volunteer to help the victims. For the last few years he has been preaching in the Zone.

In the past he was a mechanic at the KholodMash plant. After his wife left him, he decided to commit suicide, and since he was a religious man, he chose the Zone as the original method of suicide. But he survived, wore himself out for a couple of years and gained a certain authority among stalkers, thanks to his professional skills. At the moment the Master is the most competent locksmith in the Zone, repair of equipment and machinery, arrangement of defense systems of group bunkers, etc. etc. etc. - his diocese. He can get into any door, is influential, simple, but rude in communication.

Former military stalker, lieutenant colonel of the internal troops. After one of the operations in the depths of the Zone, he was left alone from the entire squad, but found evidence that they were simply set up and sent for slaughter. After that he decided not to go back, faked his own death and went to the stalkers, to deal with the problem of the Zone illegally. Silent, cynical, determined.
A rookie. New to the Zone. No detailed information available.

Unsophisticated 20 years old. He has nothing and no one left on the Big Land, so he decided to come here. He has nowhere to leave the Zone. In the Zone simply makes ends meet. He owes a lot of stalkers some money. He goes to the Zone very often, but never alone, more often he joins groups of stalkers. But few people agree to take him, because he is just an extra burden. Loot collects very rarely. Lives on handouts from other stalkers and therefore all in debt.
Veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.
Veteran stalker. Probably well equipped. No detailed information available.

Oleg Demon Gusarov. Former Black Beret, served in the Belotserkovsky brigade of Spetsnaz. Senior enlisted, senior sergeant, specialty sniper and bomber. By state of mind - a lone wolf. In the Zone he never takes his partners with him, preferring to act alone. More than once he was offered to join clans, but he always refused flatly for this reason.

A student from the Physics Department, he left the fifth year of the institute to go to the Zone to earn money. He liked to show off his scientific knowledge and argue on abstract philosophical topics. For this show-off he is disliked by stalkers. But in general, the guy is not bad. Still believes in high ideals.

Sparrow's 27 years old. Cunning, far-sighted, but sometimes he makes grave mistakes. Sometimes sneaky. Overall, leaves an ambivalent impression of himself. thin and pale. He came to the Zone out of curiosity and made a promise to himself - two months in the Zone and then home. But he stayed here. On his first foray into the Zone, he managed to walk without devices through a field full of anomalies without knowing about them. When he was informed about it, he could not recover for a long time. Since then he celebrates that day (October 9) as his second birthday.
Master of the Freedom faction. No detailed information is available.
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Freedom faction. No detailed information available.
Freedom Fighter. Usually well equipped. No detailed information available.

Leshiy, as he was nicknamed by his brother, came to the zone as a young idealist. But a few years of living on the edge of death made him a cynical realist. He considers the zone his home, and those who have not passed the test of the zone - unworthy to live on Earth.
He writes essays and stories about the Zone under the pseudonym Arkady. In the past, a journalist, meticulous, tough, but fair. Enjoys a certain respect among stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
One of the unlucky stalkers.
Bandit security guard. Questionable reputation. No detailed information available.
A common bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Rookie bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Experienced bandit. Questionable reputation. No details available.
Bandit leader.
Borov
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Monolith faction. No detailed information available.
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Sergei Shaggy
Stalker of the Duty faction. No detailed information available.
Bullet
Private soldier. No details available.
Army Special Forces. Well equipped. Details not available.
Experienced stalker. No detailed information available.
Rookie. Recently in the Zone. No detailed information available.
Representative of Project Awareness.
C-consciousness Representative
Ghost

The head of an expedition of ecologists from a mobile scientific laboratory. A world-famous scientist, once interested in natural anomalies in this part of the world, conducts research on the shore of Lake Yantar in his bunker. He is the author of a thesis on "Properties of gamma particles in fields with multidirectional gravitational acceleration". He has been known to send stalkers to their deaths to test artifact-based drugs or technologies.
Sakharov
A researcher in the mobile laboratory. No detailed information available.
Scientist
Scientist
Zombified stalker
Messer
Fryer
Sapyga
Veteran of duty
Prapor
Zob
Ghoul
Scarecrow
Father Diodorus
Master
Polkan
Inept
Oleg Demon Gusarov
Clever
Sparrow
Summoner
Prut
